alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chester; Western Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 2:43AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern New Castle and southwestern Chester Counties through 330 AM EDT... At 243 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lombard, or 12 miles west of Newark, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Newark, Elsmere, Kennett Square, New Castle, Oxford, West Grove, Newport, Glen Roy, Greenville, Stanton, North Star, Wilmington Manor, Mount Vernon and Ladenberg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
